title: The Unusual Suspects: An Improvised Murder Mystery
description:
Who Dunnit: The Improvised Murder Mystery is now The Unusual Suspects... new name, same great show.

The hottest show in the history of the 757 is NOW A NATIONALLY TOURING SHOW!

The Unusual Suspects

There’s been a murder. Everyone is a suspect. The actors on stage. Even you.

Welcome to The Unusual Suspects, an improvised murder mystery comedy.

Throughout the night, the world’s greatest detective will interrogate a cast of unusual characters, from the wacky to the dastardly.

You’ll find yourself face to face with our notorious investigator. Could he be Sherlock, Columbo, Jessica Fletcher? Not exactly. The catch is, no one ever knows which detective will show up.

No one is above suspicion, including you and your guests.

Join us at the hit show that’s played to sold-out audiences for more than three years and counting. This isn’t your standard dinner detective fare; get ready for a wild and funny night that everyone will be talking about the next day, your family, your friends, and maybe even your priest.

The Unusual Suspects is brought to you by the writers and producers of the off-Broadway and national hit: Cuff Me: The Fifty Shades of Grey Musical Parody.

The Unusual Suspects: An Improvised Murder Mystery Comedy

The second Saturday of every month at the Push Comedy Theater

The show starts at 8pm, tickets are $15

The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.

---

The Push Comedy Theater is a 99 seat venue in the heart of Norfolk's brand new Arts District. Founded by local comedy group The Pushers, the Push Comedy Theater is dedicated to bringing you live comedy from the best local and national acts.

The Push Comedy Theater hosts live sketch, improv and stand-up comedy on Friday and Saturday nights. During the week classes are offered in stand-up, sketch and improv comedy as well as acting.

Whether you're a die-hard comedy lover or a casual fan... a seasoned performer or someone who's never stepped foot on stage... the Push Comedy Theater has something for you.

title: Sketch Comedy 101 at the Push Comedy Theater
description:
Unleash your inner Will Ferrell, Tina Fey, and Jordan Peele!!!



Sketch Comedy Writing 101 is here.



Here's your chance to dive head first into the wonderful world of sketch comedy! Whether you're a seasoned writer or someone who rarely (or never) picks up a pen, this class will teach how to get the funny ideas out of your head and onto the page.   This semester we will also focus on getting your sketches online.



We will examine the various types of sketches, learn how to generate funny ideas and then turn them into sketches ready for the stage.

This class is open to everyone, no writing or comedy experience is needed.



This is a six week class that meets online every Tuesday from 6:30 PM to 8:30 PM starting August 25th. 

Cost: $200



This class caps at 10 students. Please email pusherscomedy@gmail.com to be added to our wait list with the subject “Sketch 101 Waitlist.”

Yes, and any questions? Email pusherscomedy@gmail.com

title: Laughter Class: Transitioning... Making Your Way to the Middle
description:
Laughter Class is a lecture series from the Push Comedy Theater that finds all-star comedians, actors, and performers from across the country to give a one hour lecture on their current passions. Learn the ins and outs of comedy from speakers including Emmy award winners, published writers, voice actors, theater directors, movie and TV stars, seasoned improvisers, sketch comedians, and more. 

Making Your Way to the Middle :
Transitioning... being prepared and knowing that you are enough to make the leap.  Rob Wilson is an actor who started his acting and comedy career in Virginia and then transitioned to Chicago.  For his Laughter Class, Rob will discuss the art of transitioning.  Transitioning from Virginia to Chicago.  Transitioning from straight acting to comedy.  Transitioning from improv to sketch to standup.  Rob will dive into how integral it is to use all your disciplines to inform each other, how all the experiences you've already had has already preparedyou for whatever that next step might be.  

Rob Wilson, seen recently in Discover Card's "Blabber Beak" campaign, loves and lives in the city of Chicago.  He has made the most of his time there appearing in  FOX's "Empire", SHOWTIME's "Shameless",  and both NBC's "Chicago Med" and "Chicago Fire".  Rob is currently touring the nation with The Second City's Touring Company.  He is a deeply silly man who loves playing pretend.  Follow him @rob_willsun. He is represented by Paonessa Talent. 

Laughter Class: Transitioning... Making Your Way to the Middle with Rob Wilson
Wednesday, September 2nd
7PM - 8PM via Zoom

Zoom information will be sent via email the day of each lecture. 

Laughter Class has no prerequisites, no hidden tuition fees, and no mascot (yet). Individual lectures are $10 or subscribe monthly to get one lecture free each month.

title: Improv 201: Scene Work & Short Form Games at the Training Center
description:
Improv 201: Scene Work and Short Form Games at the Training Center



This course builds upon the fundamentals and skills learned in 101. Students will focus on scene work, specifically building believable characters, strong relationships, and establishing baseline reality.



Students will also train in a variety of short form improv games similar to the ones seen on Whose Line is it Anyway?.



All classes will be outdoors and will practice social distancing measures. Masks are required. Graduation shows are delayed until further notice.



This is an intensive course offered outdoors at the Push Comedy Training Center. Class dates are 9/14, 9/15, 9/16, 9/21, 9/22, and 9/23 from 6:30 PM to 8:30 PM. This class caps at 10 students.

Cost: $200

 2710 Granby St, Norfolk, VA 23517

Please email pusherscomedy@gmail.com to be added to our wait list with the subject "Improv 201 Wait List". 

Whether you're a die-hard comedy lover or a casual fan... a seasoned performer or someone who's never stepped foot on stage... the Push Comedy Theater has something for you.



Yes, and any questions? Email pusherscomedy@gmail.com

title: Improv 301: Intro to Harold and Game at Push Comedy Theater
description:
Improv 301: Intro to Harold and Game at Push Comedy Theater



This course builds upon the fundamentals and skills learned in 101 & 201. Students will learn the beginnings 'The Harold,' a long form improvisation structure developed by Del Close. They will learn how to identify the 'game' of a scene and how to heighten these games to develop 'second beats'.



All classes will be outdoors and will practice social distancing measures. Masks are required. Graduation shows are delayed until further notice.



This is an intensive course offered outdoors at the Push Comedy Training Center. Class dates are 9/14, 9/15, 9/16, 9/21, 9/22, and 9/23 from 6:30 PM to 8:30 PM. This class caps at 10 students.

Cost: $200

763 Granby Street Norfolk, VA 23510

Please email pusherscomedy@gmail.com to be added to our wait list with the subject "Improv 301 Wait List". 

 Whether you're a die-hard comedy lover or a casual fan... a seasoned performer or someone who's never stepped foot on stage... the Push Comedy Theater has something for you.



Yes, and any questions? Email pusherscomedy@gmail.com

title: Laughter Class with Sarah Lowe: Performance Past, Present and Future
description:
Laughter Class is a lecture series from the Push Comedy Theater that finds all-star comedians, actors, and performers from across the country to give a one hour lecture on their current passions. Learn the ins and outs of comedy from speakers including Emmy award winners, published writers, voice actors, theater directors, movie and TV stars, seasoned improvisers, sketch comedians, and more.



Laughter Class:
The lecture series will be a discussion of what performance looked like in the way, way back, in the way back, last year, and what we think it will look like in the coming years.


Sarah Lowe:

Sarah Lowe is an actor, writer, comedian, choreographer, jack of all trades. She is third generation "show biz", her grandmother was the late Ruby Keeler from 42nd Street and other various films!  As an actress, she was most recently seen on screen opposite Julianne Moore in the 2019 film GLORIA BELL. Other TV/FILM credits include; BRIDESMAIDS, CRAZY EX-GIRLFRIEND, A CHRISTMAS STORY, LIVE! on FOX, GENERAL HOSPITAL and more. Pre pandemic, Sarah was performing in the hit Las Vegas production of THE ATOMIC SALOON SHOW and prior to that was the dance captain for the hit show JERSEY BOYS. She is one third of the critically acclaimed comedy trio, THE APPLE SISTERS (ECNY Best Musical Act, NYIT Outstanding Original Music). As a choreographer, she worked on GENERAL HOSPITAL Nurses Ball, AMERICA'S GOT TALENT, DAYS OF OUR LIVES and multiple youtube videos. She assisted the emmy award winning choreographer, Kathryn Burns for the 4th season of CW's hit show, CRAZY EX GIRLFRIEND. Currently, she can be seen wandering around her house in loose fitting clothing wondering "how did we get here?" and "what comes next... Locusts?"



Laughter Class with Sarah Lowe

Wednesday, September 16th

7PM - 8PM via Zoom



Zoom information will be sent via email the day of each lecture.



Laughter Class has no prerequisites, no hidden tuition fees, and no mascot (yet). Individual lectures are $10 or subscribe monthly to get one lecture free each month.
